meanings.definition: To place on or as if on a pedestal.
meanings.sent1: She was pedestalling the trophy on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The artist was pedestalling the sculpture in the art gallery.
meanings.sent3: By pedestalling her achievements, she made them seem even more impressive.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, he was pedestalling himself above everyone else.
meanings.sent5: The act of pedestalling the vase made it the centerpiece of the room.

meanings.sent1: He was pedestalling his favorite athlete as a role model.
meanings.sent2: The media tends to pedestall celebrities, making them seem perfect.
meanings.sent3: She was pedestalling her new crush, imagining him as flawless.
meanings.sent4: In her eyes, he was pedestalling himself as the hero of the story.
meanings.sent5: The act of pedestalling the idea made it seem unattainable.
